results.title: Teine Samoa: a girl of Samoa
results.creator_credit: Dave Gibson, Gibson Film Productions and John Anderson
results.brief_description: The story of Situe, a 19 year old girl living in a small village in the Pacific Islands of Western Samoa. Through her eyes, the film looks at village life and the expectations of the young educated girl who is faced with the choice of either remaining with her family or seeking a life further afield.

results.title: Teeth: their structure and care
results.brief_description: Explains the structure of teeth pointing out why they decay and the need for proper care. Dave is not fussy about his teeth and visits the dentist only when he has recurring toothache. The dentist explains the function of the different types of teeth in the mouth, the structure of a tooth and the ways in which decay begins and spreads. The film concludes by stressing the importance of eating proper foods, brushing the teeth regularly and consulting a dentist frequently.

results.title: Teeth of the wind
results.creator_credit: James Carr, World Wide and Michael Hankinson
results.brief_description: An account of the locust problem and of the progress of modern organisation and international co-operation to combat the insect. Includes close-up shots of the locust at various stages of growth from egg to maturity.

results.title: Teeth
results.creator_credit: Films Incorporated and Institut für Film und Bild
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Exploring the body”
Illustrates the growth and care of teeth, from the formation of milk teeth to their replacement by permanent teeth. Describes the inner structure of teeth and the dental treatment of decay and application of braces to correct the position of the teeth.
Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Teeny-Tiny and the Witch Woman (K)
results.brief_description: This Turkish folktale relates the adventures of Teeny Tiny and his two brothers. Lost in the forest, the three boys are welcomed by an ugly witch who appears to offer shelter. Only Teeny Tiny’s resourcefulness can save them from a dire fate. Based on the book by Barbara Walker.

results.title: Teens and AIDS: real people, real stories
results.creator_credit: Alfred Higgins, Alfred Higgins Productions and Bradley Thompson
results.brief_description: AIDS is the sixth leading cause of death for American youth aged between 15-24. This program interviews young men and women who are HIV positive and they discuss their experiences openly and frankly. The tape is aimed at teenage audiences and includes play performances devised by Young People Living With AIDS (Y.P.L.W.A.) which inform youth about safe sex, how to discuss safe sex and HIV status with prospective partners, and how to inform peers and family on HIV status.
results.title_for_label: Teens and AIDS: real people, real stories

results.title: Teenagers talk: getting through adolescence
results.creator_credit: BFA Educational Media and Sam Weiss
results.brief_description: Presents teenagers from various ethnic backgrounds commenting on the difficulties of being an adolescent. Uses animated sequences to visually express such topics as sex, parents, drugs, peer pressure, individuality, conformity, friendship and physical maturation.
